_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
I. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY POLICIES

Pacific Diazo Products recognizes management's responsibility to protect it's employees, equipment, property, and the environment. The safety and health of all personnel are very important. The control of accidents has been and will continue to be a basic responsibility of all personnel at the facility.  The Pacific Diazo Products PSM/RMP program assigns and documents the specific responsibilities for developing, implementing and integrating the OSHA PSM and the EPA RMP standards into its safety program. This PSM/RMP program focuses attention on Pacific Diazo Products believes that Employee Participation is the key to a successful PSM/RMP program. Operating level employees, particularly the Distribution Supervisor and the Storage System Operator have been deeply involved, in the development of the Program and they assume the major responsibility for operating the Pacific Diazo Products Storage facility safely.
The Pacific Diazo Products Emergency Response Program has been developed in cooperation, and with the support of the San Bernadino Co. Fire Department Hazardous Material Division. All Pacific Diazo Products employees will receive documented emergency response training.

II. STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

Pacific Diazo Products is a leading Industrial Ammonia Distributing Company in the United States. Refer to Offsite Consequence Analysis (OCA) document(s), located in the Pacific Diazo Products corporate offices in Colton, CA, for onsite anhydrous ammonia and ammonium hydroxide quantities. Anhydrous Ammonia and Ammonium Hydroxide (aqua ammonia) are the only hazardous materials on site in the storage location in amounts above the threshold quantity.

III. SUMMARY OF WORST CASE AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIOS

Refer to Offsite Consequence Analysis (OCA) document(s) located in the PDP corporate offices in Colton, CA.

IV. DESCRIPTION OF THE PACIFIC DIAZO PRODUCTS ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PRE

VENTION PROGRAM

Pacific Diazo Products coordinates its Emergency Training and Response activities with the San Bernadino Co. Fire Dept. Hazardous Materials Division to practice, train and update their Emergency Action Plan.  Pacific Diazo Products conducts triennial PSM/RMP compliance audits of the entire PSM/RMP program to identify strengths and weaknesses and make improvements.  Pacific Diazo Products considers the PSM/RMP manuals to be "living" documents that must be updated and revised regularly to maintain their viability.  Pacific Diazo Products emphasizes and insists on "employee participation" from the Ammonia Storage System Operator in all aspects of the development, implementation, and integration of their PSM/RMP program. Pacific Diazo Products provides a comprehensive, computer based, user friendly training program with "one-on-one" teacher involvement in specific training modules for each ammonia storage system employee.

Pacific Diazo Products maintains a pro-active "open-door" policy toward its neighbors and concerned community citizens. Facility tours and risk management discussions are scheduled and conducted upon written request and Pacific Diazo Products? approval.

V. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENTAL RELEASE HISTORY

There have been no releases of ammonia during the past five years that resulted in an injury, or that had an off-site impact, or that resulted in significant property damage either on or off-site.

VI. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Pacific Diazo Products? storage facility employees have been trained evacuate to designated assembly location contingent upon wind direction.  The emergency action plan has been coordinated with the San Bernadino Co. Fire Department Hazardous Material Division Emergency Response Plan.

VII. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Pacific Diazo Products recognizes that (even though their Ammonia release and injury experience has been excellent) their PSM/RMP program will provide much needed Emphasis and Improvement to their

safety effort.  The PSM/RMP program is considered to be a set of "living" documents and procedures that will require constant attention, development, and revision before "Safety" truly becomes "second nature."

Pacific Diazo Products expects to improve safety performance by emphasizing the following elements of their PSM/RMP Program:

(1) Employee Participation is the "Key" to a successful program. The Distribution Supervisor and the Storage System Operator have been deeply involved in verifying the P&ID's, Developing and updating the Standard Operating Procedures, and performing the documented Preventive Maintenance Inspections.

(2) The Pacific Diazo Products PSM/RMP Program is: (a) computer based, (b)user friendly, (c) includes "one-on-one" involvement with specified and qualified trainers, (d) written to minimize paperwork and maximize documentation, and (e) written to be understood and used by the Ammonia Storage System Operator.

(3) All recommendations developed during the HAZOP were designed to improve the safety performance of the Pacific Diazo Products Storage System Process. Pacific Diazo Products expects to evaluate each recommendation in a timely manner and implement, as soon as possible, those recommendations that will reduce the possibility of a release and/or mitigate the consequences of an unintentional release.
